description.p: As much part of nature, as nature are part of them, these rangers spend their lives tending to nature. Covered in vines, some of them protect sacred groves, while others track down and hunt creatures who seek to despoil nature. A few of them have spent so many years in the wild, they barely remember what lives they lived or what friends they had a lifetime ago.

sheet.description: Covered in vines, some of them protect sacred groves, while others track down and hunt creatures who seek to despoil nature.

description.p: You gain conclave spells at the ranger levels listed.

Starting at 3rd level, you've given yourself fully to nature. You gain the druidcraft and thorn whip cantrip. When you deal damage to a target marked with Hunter's Quarry with thorn whip, you deal an additional 1d6 damage.

sheet.description: When you deal damage to a target marked with Hunter's Quarry with thorn whip, you deal an additional 1d6 damage.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, as you safeguard nature, nature gives you its protection. After finish a long rest, vines has grown to cover your body. While they cover your body you gain an AC equal to 14 + your Wisdom modifier.
As an action, you can have the vines fall off, where they fall the ground within 5 feet is well nourished for a week.

sheet.description: After finish a long rest, vines has grown to cover your body. While they cover your body you gain an AC of {{symbiotic:defense}}. As an action, you can have the vines fall off, where they fall the ground within 5 feet is well nourished for a week.

description.p: At 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Additionally, when taking the Attack action, you can replace one attack with casting the thorn whip cantrip.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Additionally, when taking the Attack action, you can replace one attack with casting the thorn whip cantrip.

description.p: At 7th level, nature does its best to protect you and your allies. While you have a creature marked with Hunter's Quarry, the area within 5 feet of you counts as difficult terrain. You can choose for a creature to be unaffected.

sheet.description: While you have a creature marked with Hunter's Quarry, the area within 5 feet of you counts as difficult terrain. You can choose for a creature to be unaffected.

description.p: At 11th level, your attacks land with the full force of nature. You can add your Wisdom modifier to weapon damage rolls.
Additionally, when casting thorn whip or a conclave spell, you can choose to deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Wisdom modifier to each creature affected by the spell.

sheet.description: You can add {{wisdom:modifier}} to weapon damage rolls. Additionally, when casting thorn whip or a conclave spell, you can choose to deal {{widsom:modifier}} bludgeoning damage to each creature affected by the spell.

description.p: At 15th level, your body doesn't tear and grow old as other's do. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

sheet.description: For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

description.p: At 20th level, you can forcefully return a creature to nature. As an action, choose a creature within 30 feet that you can see. The creature takes 8d8 bludgeoning damage as vines and roots spew forth from the ground and grabs a hold of the creature. The creature must then roll a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice) versus your range spell save DC. On a failure, the creature is restrained and is pulled up to 30 feet to the ground, taking 2d8 bludgeoning on the start of each of its turns for 1 minute or until it is no longer restrained.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.
